content: Written content available on the Site has generally been made available by Wikipedia or its licensors under the the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4 0 International License ("CC BY-SA") and/or theGNU Free Documentation License("GFDL") The Site uses all such text pursuant to the terms of the CC BY-SA and you are free to use such content in compliance with such license Certain specific text may be made available by Wikipedia under other free licenses, and the Site makes such text available under the applicable license Images and video available on the Site are generally in the public domain or have been made available on Wikipedia under free licenses or using a "fair use" exception Wikiwand makes best efforts to comply with the applicable licenses, and appreciate any questions or comments you have regarding our compliance policies The policy of Wikiwand is not to infringe or violate the intellectual property rights or other rights of any third party and, if properly informed, Wikiwand will remove material appearing on the Site that infringes the rights of any third party Under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 (the "DMCA"), Wikiwand will remove any content if properly notified of that such material infringes third party rights, and may do so at its sole discretion, without prior notice to users at any time If you believe that something appearing on the Site infringes your copyright, you may send us a notice requesting that it be removed, or access to it blocked In addition, Wikiwand Map uses OpenStreetMap data, which is available under the Open Database License Apple has no responsibility for the Site or the content of the Site, including in respect of claims of intellectual property infringement, product liability or that the Site does not conform with applicable law
summaries_mistral:
The text describes the terms of service for Wikiwand, a website that primarily uses content from Wikipedia under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA) and GNU Free Documentation License (GFDL). Images and videos are typically in the public domain, made available on Wikipedia under free licenses or via the "fair use" exception. Wikiwand aims to respect intellectual property rights and remove any content that infringes upon them.

In case of copyright infringement, users can request removal of the material by sending a notice to Wikiwand. The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) allows Wikiwand to remove such content at its discretion without prior notice to users.

Wikiwand also uses OpenStreetMap data under the Open Database License. Apple has no responsibility for the Site or its content, including claims of intellectual property infringement, product liability, or non-compliance with applicable law.

The Terms of Service for Wikiwand state that most of the written content on the site is available under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA) and/or the GNU Free Documentation License (GFDL). Images and videos are typically in the public domain, free-licensed, or fall under the "fair use" exception. Wikiwand makes every effort to comply with these licenses.

The site does not infringe or violate any third party's intellectual property rights or other rights. If properly informed, Wikiwand will remove content that infringes on a third party's rights. This is in compliance with the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 (DMCA).

If you believe that something on the site infringes your copyright, you may request its removal or access blocking. The site also uses OpenStreetMap data under the Open Database License.

Apple has no responsibility for the Site, including claims of intellectual property infringement, product liability, or non-conformity with applicable law.

The Terms of Service for Wikiwand states that most of the written content on the site is available under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA) and/or the GNU Free Documentation License (GFDL). Some specific text may be available under other free licenses. Images and videos on the site are either in the public domain, made available under free licenses, or used via a "fair use" exception.

Wikiwand aims to comply with all applicable licenses and welcomes questions or comments about compliance policies. The platform does not intend to infringe or violate any third party's intellectual property rights. If informed of potential infringements, Wikiwand will remove the content.

Under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA), Wikiwand will remove any content that infringes upon third-party rights when properly notified. The removal may happen at Wikiwand's sole discretion without prior notice to users.

If you believe that your copyright is being infringed on the site, you can request it be removed by sending a notification. Additionally, Wikiwand Map uses OpenStreetMap data, available under the Open Database License.

Apple has no responsibility for the Site or its content, including in respect of intellectual property infringement, product liability, or non-conformity with applicable law.
summaries_llama2:
The Terms of Service for Wikiwand.com outline the following:

1. Written content on the site is available under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA) and/or the GNU Free Documentation License (GFDL).
2. Images and video on the site are generally in the public domain or have been made available under free licenses or using a "fair use" exception.
3. Wikiwand makes best efforts to comply with applicable licenses, and appreciates any questions or comments regarding compliance policies.
4. The policy of Wikiwand is not to infringe or violate the intellectual property rights or other rights of any third party. If properly informed, Wikiwand will remove material appearing on the site that infringes the rights of any third party.
5. Under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 (DMCA), Wikiwand will remove any content if properly notified of its infringement.
6. If you believe that something on the site infringes your copyright, you may send a notice requesting removal or access blocking.
7. OpenStreetMap data used by Wikiwand is available under the Open Database License.
8. Apple has no responsibility for the site or its content, including claims of intellectual property infringement or non-conformity with applicable law.

Sure! Here's a summary of the Terms of Service text from <https://www.wikiwand.com>:

* The written content on the site is available under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License ("CC BY-SA") and/or the GNU Free Documentation License ("GFDL").
* Images and video on the site are generally in the public domain or have been made available under free licenses or using a "fair use" exception.
* Wikiwand makes best efforts to comply with applicable licenses, and appreciates any questions or comments regarding its compliance policies.
* The policy of Wikiwand is not to infringe or violate the intellectual property rights or other rights of any third party. If properly informed, Wikiwand will remove material appearing on the site that infringes the rights of any third party.
* Under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 (the "DMCA"), Wikiwand will remove any content if properly notified of its infringement and may do so at its sole discretion, without prior notice to users.
* If you believe that something appearing on the site infringes your copyright, you may send a notice requesting its removal or access blocking.
* Wikiwand uses OpenStreetMap data, which is available under the Open Database License.
* Apple has no responsibility for the site or its content, including claims of intellectual property infringement, product liability, or non-conformity with applicable law.

Sure! Here's a summary of the Terms of Service for Wikiwand:

* Written content on the site is available under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA) and/or the GNU Free Documentation License (GFDL).
* Images and video on the site are either in the public domain or have been made available under free licenses or using a "fair use" exception.
* Wikiwand makes best efforts to comply with applicable licenses and welcomes questions or comments regarding its compliance policies.
* The policy of Wikiwand is not to infringe or violate the intellectual property rights or other rights of any third party. If properly informed, Wikiwand will remove material appearing on the site that infringes the rights of any third party.
* Under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 (DMCA), Wikiwand will remove any content if properly notified of its infringement and may do so at its sole discretion, without prior notice to users.

* Wikiwand also uses OpenStreetMap data, which is available under the Open Database License.

summary_reference: Wikiwand hosts content primarily sourced from Wikipedia, available under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 (CC BY-SA) and GNU Free Documentation License (GFDL), allowing users to use it per these terms. Some text may fall under other free licenses, while images and videos are typically public domain, licensed freely, or used under 'fair use.' Wikiwand strives to comply with these licenses and respects third-party intellectual property rights, removing infringing material under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) upon proper notification. Users can report copyright violations for removal or blocking. Wikiwand Map uses OpenStreetMap data under the Open Database License. Apple bears no responsibility for Wikiwand’s content or related legal claims.

content: GitHub TermsGitHub Terms of ServiceGitHub Corporate Terms of ServiceGitHub Terms for Additional Products and FeaturesGitHub Community GuidelinesGitHub Community Code of ConductGitHub Pre-release License TermsGitHub Sponsors Additional TermsGitHub Registered Developer AgreementGitHub Marketplace Terms of ServiceGitHub Marketplace Developer AgreementGitHub Research Program TermsGitHub Open Source Applications Terms and ConditionsGitHub Event TermsGitHub Event Code of ConductGitHub Educational Use AgreementGitHub Copilot Extension Developer Policy GitHub Pre-release License Terms GitHub Pre-release License Terms Copyright Infringement and DMCA Policy Copyright Infringement and DMCA Policy Intellectual Property Notice Intellectual Property Notice For example, you may be a member of an organization on GitHub with its own terms or license agreements; you may download an application that integrates with GitHub; or you may use GitHub to authenticate to another service Your use of the Website and Service must not violate any applicable laws, including copyright or trademark laws, export control or sanctions laws, or other laws in your jurisdiction If you're posting anything you did not create yourself or do not own the rights to, you agree that you are responsible for any Content you post; that you will only submit Content that you have the right to post; and that you will fully comply with any third party licenses relating to Content you post These license grants apply to Your Content If you upload Content that already comes with a license granting GitHub the permissions we need to run our Service, no additional license is required The licenses you grant to us will end when you remove Your Content from our servers, unless other Users have forked it This license includes the right to do things like copy it to our database and make backups; show it to you and other users; parse it into a search index or otherwise analyze it on our servers; share it with other users; and perform it, in case Your Content is something like music or video This license does not grant GitHub the right to sell Your Content If you set your pages and repositories to be viewed publicly, you grant each User of GitHub a nonexclusive, worldwide license to use, display, and perform Your Content through the GitHub Service and to reproduce Your Content solely on GitHub as permitted through GitHub's functionality (for example, through forking) You may grant further rights if you adopt a license If you are uploading Content you did not create or own, you are responsible for ensuring that the Content you upload is licensed under terms that grant these permissions to other GitHub Users Whenever you add Content to a repository containing notice of a license, you license that Content under the same terms, and you agree that you have the right to license that Content under those terms If you have a separate agreement to license that Content under different terms, such as a contributor license agreement, that agreement will supersede If you believe that content on our website violates your copyright, please contact us in accordance with our Digital Millennium Copyright Act Policy If you are a copyright owner and you believe that content on GitHub violates your rights, please contact us via our convenient DMCA form or by emailing copyright@github Before sending a takedown request, you must consider legal uses such as fair use and licensed uses GitHub and our licensors, vendors, agents, and/or our content providers retain ownership of all intellectual property rights of any kind related to the Website and Service The look and feel of the Website and Service is copyright © GitHub, Inc This Agreement is licensed under this Creative Commons Zero license If you choose to give us any ideas, know-how, algorithms, code contributions, suggestions, enhancement requests, recommendations or any other feedback for our products or services (collectively, “Feedback”), you acknowledge and agree that GitHub will have a royalty-free, fully paid-up, worldwide, transferable, sub-licensable, irrevocable and perpetual license to implement, use, modify, commercially exploit and/or incorporate the Feedback into our products, services, and documentation GitHub may assign or delegate these Terms of Service and/or the GitHub Privacy Statement, in whole or in part, to any person or entity at any time with or without your consent, including the license grant in Section D
summaries_mistral:
1. GitHub's Terms of Service outline the rules for using their services, which include GitHub, GitHub Marketplace, events, educational use, and more.

2. Users must ensure their actions do not violate any laws, and they are responsible for any content they post that they did not create or own.

3. If users upload content to GitHub, they grant GitHub certain rights, such as copying it, backing it up, showing it to users, parsing it, sharing it, and performing it (in case the content is music or video). However, GitHub does not have the right to sell the user's content.

4. Users who make their pages and repositories publicly viewable grant each GitHub user a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, display, and perform their content through GitHub.

5. If users upload content they did not create or own, they are responsible for ensuring it is licensed in a way that grants these permissions to other GitHub users.

6. Users can grant further rights if they adopt a different license. If there is a separate agreement to license the content under different terms, it will supersede.

7. If you believe your copyright has been violated on GitHub, follow the Digital Millennium Copyright Act Policy provided.

8. All intellectual property related to the Website and Service belongs to GitHub or its licensors, vendors, agents, and/or content providers.

9. If users provide feedback to GitHub, they grant GitHub a royalty-free, fully paid-up, worldwide, transferable, sub-licensable, irrevocable, and perpetual license to implement, use, modify, commercially exploit, and incorporate the feedback into their products, services, and documentation.

10. GitHub can assign or delegate these Terms of Service to any person or entity at any time, with or without the user's consent.

This summary is for convenience only and does not replace the full text of GitHub's Terms of Service. It is recommended to read the full terms before using the service.

1. The provided text outlines various terms and policies related to GitHub's services:
     - GitHub Terms of Service (ToS)
     - GitHub Corporate Terms of Service (if you're part of an organization)
     - Terms for Additional Products and Features (such as downloaded applications)
     - Community Guidelines and Code of Conduct (regarding user behavior)
     - Pre-release License Terms (for testing new features)
     - Sponsors, Registered Developer Agreements, Marketplace Terms, and agreements specific to the Research Program, Open Source Applications, Events, Copilot Extension Development, etc.

2. Key points include:
    - Users must comply with applicable laws, including copyright, trademark, export control, and sanctions laws.
    - Users are responsible for any content they post that they did not create or do not own the rights to.
    - Licenses granted to GitHub will end when you remove your content from their servers unless other users have forked it.
    - The licenses you grant to GitHub permit activities like copying, displaying, analyzing, sharing, and performing your content (except selling).
    - If you set your pages and repositories to be publicly viewable, you grant each GitHub user a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, display, and perform your content through the GitHub Service.
    - You may grant further rights if you adopt a license.
    - If you upload content you did not create or own, ensure it is licensed under terms that allow other GitHub users to do as stated above.
    - For copyright infringement, follow GitHub's Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) Policy.
    - Intellectual property rights related to the Website and Service belong to GitHub or its licensors.
    - If you provide feedback for GitHub products or services, GitHub has a royalty-free license to implement, use, modify, commercially exploit, and incorporate your Feedback into their products, services, and documentation.

3. The Agreement is licensed under the Creative Commons Zero (CC0) license.
   - GitHub may assign or delegate these Terms of Service and/or the Privacy Policy to any person or entity at any time, with or without your consent

1. The provided text outlines various terms and agreements related to using GitHub's services, which include the main Terms of Service, Corporate Terms, Terms for Additional Products and Features, Community Guidelines, Code of Conduct, Pre-release License Terms, Sponsors Additional Terms, Registered Developer Agreement, Marketplace Terms of Service and Developer Agreement, Research Program Terms, Open Source Applications Terms and Conditions, Event Terms, Event Code of Conduct, Educational Use Agreement, Copilot Extension Developer Policy, GitHub Pre-release License Terms, Copyright Infringement and DMCA Policy, Intellectual Property Notice, and the GitHub Contributor License Agreement (CLA).

2. Users must comply with applicable laws, including copyright and trademark laws, export control or sanctions laws, and other relevant regulations in their jurisdiction. If users post content that they did not create or do not own, they are responsible for ensuring it is properly licensed to allow GitHub Users to use it.

3. Licenses granted to GitHub by the user will end when they remove their content from GitHub's servers, unless other users have forked it. The licenses include the right to copy, backup, display, perform, analyze, and share the content, but do not grant GitHub the right to sell it.

4. If a user's public pages or repositories are viewed, they grant each GitHub User a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, display, and perform their content through the GitHub Service and reproduce it as permitted by GitHub's functionality. Users may adopt additional licenses for their content if desired.

5. If users believe that content on GitHub violates their copyright, they can contact GitHub via the DMCA form or email. They must consider legal uses such as fair use and licensed uses before sending a takedown request.

6. All intellectual property rights related to the GitHub Website and Service are owned by GitHub, Inc., and users grant GitHub a royalty-free license for their ideas, know-how, algorithms, code contributions, suggestions, enhancement requests, recommendations, or other feedback provided to GitHub's products or services (Feedback). This license is transferable, sub-licensable, irrevocable, and perpetual.

7. GitHub may assign or delegate these terms to any person or entity at any time with or without the user's consent. The entire Agreement is licensed under a Creative Commons Zero (CC0) license.
summaries_llama2:
These are the terms of service for GitHub, a web-based platform for version control and collaboration. The terms cover the following:

1. License grants: You grant GitHub a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, display, and perform Your Content through the GitHub Service and to reproduce Your Content solely on GitHub as permitted through GitHub's functionality. If you set your pages and repositories to be viewed publicly, you grant each User of GitHub a nonexclusive, worldwide license to use, display, and perform Your Content.
2. Intellectual property rights: GitHub and its licensors retain ownership of all intellectual property rights related to the Website and Service. You agree that any ideas, know-how, algorithms, code contributions, suggestions, enhancement requests, recommendations or other feedback you provide (Feedback) is owned by GitHub and can be used as described in the license grant above.
3. Copyright infringement: If you believe that content on GitHub violates your copyright, you must contact GitHub in accordance with its Digital Millennium Copyright Act Policy.
4. Terms of service: This Agreement is licensed under Creative Commons Zero license, which means it can be used and shared without any restrictions.
5. Ownership: GitHub and its licensors retain ownership of all intellectual property rights related to the Website and Service.
6. Changes to terms of service: GitHub may assign or delegate these Terms of Service and/or the GitHub Privacy Statement, in whole or in part, to any person or entity at any time with or without your consent.
7. Governing law: These Terms of Service are governed by and shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the state of Delaware, United States of America.
8. Entire agreement: These Terms of Service constitute the entire agreement between you and GitHub and supersede all prior or contemporaneous agreements, whether written or oral, related to your use of the Website and Service.
9. Severability: If any provision of these Terms of Service is found to be unenforceable, the remaining provisions will remain in effect.
10. Waiver: Failure to enforce any provision of these Terms of Service will not constitute a waiver of that provision or any other provision of these Terms of Service.

The GitHub Terms of Service outline the terms and conditions for using the GitHub website and service. Here are some key points:

1. License Grant: By uploading content to GitHub, you grant the company a nonexclusive, worldwide license to use, display, and perform your content through the GitHub service. This includes the right to copy, store, and display your content on GitHub's servers.
2. Responsibility for Content: If you upload content that you did not create or own, you are responsible for ensuring that the content is licensed under terms that grant these permissions to other GitHub users.
3. Copyright Ownership: GitHub and its licensors, vendors, agents, and content providers retain ownership of all intellectual property rights related to the website and service.
4. Feedback: If you provide feedback or suggestions to GitHub, you acknowledge and agree that GitHub has a royalty-free, fully paid-up, worldwide, transferable, sub-licensable, irrevocable, and perpetual license to implement, use, modify, commercially exploit, and/or incorporate your feedback into their products or services.
5. Terms of Service Changes: GitHub reserves the right to change these terms of service at any time without notice. Your continued use of the website and service constitutes acceptance of any changes.
6. Jurisdiction: These terms of service are governed by and shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the state of Delaware, United States. Any disputes arising from these terms of service shall be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association.
7. Entire Agreement: These terms of service constitute the entire agreement between you and GitHub regarding your use of the website and service, and supersede any prior agreements or understandings.
8. Severability: If any part of these terms of service is found to be unenforceable, the remaining parts will remain in effect.
9. Waiver: Any failure to enforce any provision of these terms of service shall not constitute a waiver of that provision or any other provision.
10. Dispute Resolution: GitHub is committed to resolving any disputes arising from these terms of service through friendly and respectful dialogue. If you have a concern or dispute with GitHub, please contact our support team for assistance.

The GitHub Terms of Service outline the terms and conditions for using the GitHub website and service. Here are some key points from the text:

1. Membership and License Agreements: If you're a member of an organization on GitHub, you may have your own terms or license agreements that apply to your use of the platform. You may also download applications that integrate with GitHub, or use GitHub to authenticate to other services. Your use of the website and service must not violate any applicable laws, including copyright or trademark laws, export control or sanctions laws, or other laws in your jurisdiction.
2. Content Licenses: If you post anything on GitHub that you did not create yourself or do not own the rights to, you agree that you are responsible for any Content you post. You grant GitHub a nonexclusive, worldwide license to use, display, and perform Your Content through the GitHub Service and to reproduce Your Content solely on GitHub as permitted through GitHub's functionality (e.g., through forking). You may also grant further rights if you adopt a license. If you upload Content that you did not create or own, you are responsible for ensuring that the Content is licensed under terms that grant these permissions to other GitHub Users.
3. Ownership and Licensors: GitHub and its licensors, vendors, agents, and content providers retain ownership of all intellectual property rights related to the Website and Service. The look and feel of the Website and Service is copyright © GitHub, Inc. This Agreement is licensed under the Creative Commons Zero license.
4. Feedback: If you provide any ideas, know-how, algorithms, code contributions, suggestions, enhancement requests, recommendations or other feedback for GitHub's products or services (collectively, "Feedback"), you acknowledge and agree that GitHub has a royalty-free, fully paid-up, worldwide, transferable, sub-licensable, irrevocable and perpetual license to implement, use, modify, commercially exploit and/or incorporate the Feedback into their products, services, and documentation.
5. Terms and Changes: GitHub may assign or delegate these Terms of Service and/or the GitHub Privacy Statement in whole or in part to any person or entity at any time with or without your consent. GitHub may also change these Terms of Service from time to time without notice to you.

In summary, these Terms of Service outline the terms and conditions for using GitHub, including the licenses granted to GitHub for Content uploaded by users, ownership of intellectual property rights, and the license grant for Feedback. The agreement also includes provisions for changes to the Terms of Service and assignability.
summary_reference: GitHub’s Terms of Service govern the use of its website and services, requiring compliance with applicable laws, including copyright and trademark regulations. Users are responsible for the content they post, ensuring they have rights to it and that it adheres to third-party licenses. By uploading content, users grant GitHub a worldwide license to store, display, analyze, and share it as needed to operate the service, and public content can be used or reproduced by other GitHub users via features like forking. GitHub respects intellectual property rights, removing infringing content under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) upon proper notice. The company retains ownership of its intellectual property, while user feedback grants GitHub a perpetual license to use it. Terms may be assigned by GitHub without user consent.

foreseeable result of our breach of the Terms or our negligence up to the limit specified in sub-section below titled Cap on Liability, below
summaries_mistral:
Commonsensemedia.org (referred to as CSM) owns and operates the site with partners under contractual arrangements. All content (Materials) is copyrighted and unauthorized use, modification, or distribution is prohibited. Users may not use any trademarks without express written permission. By submitting reviews, comments, suggestions, or ideas, users grant CSM a worldwide, non-exclusive license to use the content in any way for any purpose. Users must own the rights necessary for their submissions and indemnify CSM for claims resulting from submitted materials.

Users are granted limited access to the site for personal use only, subject to the terms of these ToS. Unauthorized use automatically terminates any permission or license granted by CSM. The site's use is prohibited for commercial purposes, public presentations, unlawful, offensive, or infringing content, and removal of copyright notices.

Users may file a DMCA notice if they believe material hosted on the site infringes their copyright. Counter-notices can also be filed in cases where a notice of copyright infringement has been wrongly filed against a user. Notices and counter-notices must be sent to CSM's Chief Financial Officer.

CSM owns the site, its content, and is protected by various proprietary rights. Users may not assign, transfer, or sublicense these ToS without CSM's prior written consent. In cases where CSM may be liable for loss suffered by a user during non-commercial use of the site, their liability is limited to foreseeable losses resulting from a breach of ToS or negligence up to a specified limit.

The text provided outlines the terms of service for Commonsensemedia.org (the "Site"). Here's a summary:

1. Ownership and Intellectual Property Rights: The Site is owned by Commonsense Media (CSM) and its licensors/suppliers, and no part of it can be modified or used without express written permission from CSM. Trademarks must not be misused, and CSM will enforce its intellectual property rights through legal means if necessary.

2. User Submissions: By submitting reviews, comments, ideas, or other materials to the Site, users grant CSM and its designees a worldwide, non-exclusive, sublicenseable, assignable, royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable right to use these submissions in any way they choose, for any purpose. Users must have rights to grant these licenses and warrant that their submissions are accurate, lawful, and will not cause injury to others or violate the Terms of Use.

3. Limited License: Subject to compliance with the Terms of Use, CSM grants users a limited license to access and use the Site for personal purposes only, on a single device. Use or downloading of any materials is conditioned upon accepting any related license agreements.

4. Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Sharealike License: Some Materials may be available under this license for personal, non-commercial use. Users must attribute the materials to CSM and comply with other terms of the license.

5. Prohibited Uses: Users must not use the Site or any Materials for unlawful, fraudulent, abusive, defamatory, or obscene purposes. Users are also prohibited from sharing non-public information about companies without authorization and from using the Site for commercial purposes. Removing copyright or other proprietary rights notices is strictly prohibited.

6. Copyright Infringement Claims: The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) provides recourse for copyright owners who believe their rights have been infringed on the Site. Users can request material be removed by sending a notice to CSM's Chief Financial Officer.

7. Liability Limitation: In case of any loss or damage suffered by users as a result of using the Site, CSM will only be responsible for foreseeable losses resulting from its breach of the Terms or negligence, up to a specified limit (not provided in the text).

8. Assignment and Transfer: These terms are not assignable, transferable, or sublicenseable by users without CSM's prior written consent.

The text provided outlines the Terms of Service for Commonsensemedia.org (the "Site"), which is owned and operated by Common Sense Media ("CSM") in partnership with others under contractual arrangements. Users are prohibited from modifying or using the Materials (including intellectual property) found on the Site for any purpose other than intended, as doing so would violate CSM's copyright and other proprietary rights.

   No license to use any Trademark is granted without express written permission from CSM, its licensors, suppliers, or the third-party owner of such Trademark. Misuse of any Trademarks is strictly prohibited, and CSM will aggressively enforce its intellectual property rights in these Trademarks through civil and criminal proceedings.

   By sending reviews, comments, creative suggestions, ideas, notes, concepts, information, or other materials ("Submissions") to the Site or posting them on any area of the Site, users grant CSM and its designees a worldwide, non-exclusive, sublicenseable (through multiple tiers), assignable, royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable right and license to reproduce, distribute, adapt, modify, edit, create derivative works of, perform, display (publicly or otherwise), make, have made, sell, offer for sale, import, analyze, and otherwise use such Submissions in any medium now known or hereafter developed, for any purpose whatsoever, commercial or otherwise. Users also grant CSM the right to use their submitted names in connection with these Submissions if desired.

   Users are responsible for ensuring that they own or control all rights necessary to grant the licenses granted above and that their Submissions do not violate these Terms of Use or cause injury to any person or entity. Users must indemnify CSM and its affiliates or sublicensees for all claims resulting from Submissions provided by them.

   Subject to users' compliance with these Terms of Use, CSM grants users a limited license to access and make personal use of the Site (or any portion of the Site) to which they are granted access under these Terms of Use, on any single device. Users may be granted a license to certain Materials via the Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Sharealike License for their personal, non-commercial use, as provided in a notice at the bottom of such Materials.

   Users are prohibited from using CSM's name or any of its Trademarks, except as permitted by these Terms of Use. Users may not copy, sell, rent, sublicense, or assign the Member Services to any third party without CSM's prior written consent.

Please note that this summary is not a legal document and does not replace the Terms of Use themselves, which are subject to change without notice.

The terms of service for Common Sense Media outline the rules and guidelines for using their website and services. Here is a summary of the key points:

* The site is owned and operated by Common Sense Media, with the assistance of contractors and suppliers.
* The materials on the site, including any intellectual property rights, are protected by international copyright laws and are valid and enforceable.
* Modifying or using the materials without permission is prohibited and can result in legal action.
* You grant Common Sense Media a worldwide, non-exclusive, sublicensable license to use any submissions (reviews, comments, etc.) you make on the site.
* You represent and warrant that you own or have the necessary rights to submit any content.
* The site is provided for personal, non-commercial use only, and you are prohibited from using it for commercial purposes without permission.
* You agree not to use the site or any materials in a way that violates laws or respects the rights of others.
* If you believe any material on the site infringes your copyright, you can send a notice requesting removal.
* Common Sense Media may terminate any user who it reasonably believes to be a repeat copyright infringer.
* The terms of use are not assignable or transferable without prior written consent from Common Sense Media.
* Common Sense Media is only responsible for loss or damage suffered by you that is a foreseeable result of their breach of the terms or negligence, up to a specified limit.

The terms of service for Common Sense Media outline the rules and guidelines for using their website and services. Here is a summary of the key points:

1. Ownership and Licensing: Common Sense Media owns the Site and the materials available on it, including any intellectual property rights. By using the Site, you grant them a non-exclusive, sublicensable license to use your submissions, including the right to reproduce, distribute, adapt, modify, edit, display, perform, and transmit them.
2. Personal Use: You are allowed to access and use the Site for personal, non-commercial use, subject to these Terms of Use.
3. Member Services: Your use of the Member Services must be only for personal, non-commercial use. You agree not to use any Member Service for public presentation or commercial purposes without authorization.
4. Prohibited Activities: You are prohibited from using the Site or any Materials in a way that is unlawful, fraudulent, threatening, abusive, libelous, defamatory, obscene, or otherwise objectionable. You also cannot use any material protected by trade secret, copyright, trademark, right of publicity, or privacy without authorization.
5. Copyright Infringement: If you believe that any materials hosted on the Site infringe your copyright, you can send a notice to Common Sense Media requesting removal or blocking of the material. If you wrongly file a notice of copyright infringement, you can also send a counter-notice.
6. Termination: Common Sense Media may terminate any user who it reasonably believes to be a repeat copyright infringer.
7. Limit on Liability: Common Sense Media is only responsible for loss or damage you suffer that is a foreseeable result of their breach of the Terms or negligence, up to a certain limit specified in the terms.

Overall, these terms outline the rules and guidelines for using Common Sense Media's website and services, including what activities are prohibited, how to report copyright infringement, and the limit on liability for any damages or losses that may occur.
summary_reference: Common Sense Media (CSM) owns and operates the Site, retaining all intellectual property rights to its materials, protected by copyright, trademark, and other laws. Users are granted a limited, personal-use license to access the Site, but unauthorized use or modification of materials is prohibited. By submitting content, users grant CSM a perpetual, royalty-free license to use, modify, and distribute it globally, while warranting they have rights to do so. Some materials are available under the Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Sharealike License for personal use with attribution. CSM complies with the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA), removing infringing content upon proper notice. User submissions must not violate laws or third-party rights, and misuse terminates any granted permissions. CSM limits liability for non-commercial use to foreseeable damages.

summaries_mistral:
The Terms of Service for Definitions.net state that all materials on the website are copyrighted by STANDS4 LLC in 2025, and any infringement will be prosecuted under international copyright law and the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DCMA). Users who submit content to the site grant STANDS4 a perpetual, royalty-free license to use, modify, adapt, publish, translate, create derivative works from, distribute, perform, and exercise all copyright and publicity rights worldwide. The user agrees to indemnify STANDS4 against any intellectual property or proprietary rights claims arising from content published to the site.

The DMCA Notice outlines the procedure for notifying STANDS4 about alleged copyright infringements on the Service. To be valid, a notification must include an electronic or physical signature, identification of the copyrighted work, location of the infringing material, contact information, a statement that use of the material is not authorized by the copyright owner, and a statement made under penalty of perjury.

Some content on the site derives from external sources such as WordNet®, GCIDE, Wikipedia, Wiktionary, Freebase, and LanguageTool, all licensed under their respective terms. STANDS4 may limit access to the Service or terminate the accounts of users who infringe intellectual property rights.

The Terms of Service for definitions.net, owned by STANDS4 LLC, outline the following key points:

1. Copyright Policy: All materials on the website are copyrighted in 2025 by STANDS4 LLC. Any copyright infringements will be prosecuted under international copyright law and the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DCMA).

2. User Contributions: If you contribute content to the website, you grant STANDS4 a perpetual, royalty-free, non-exclusive, sub-licensable right to use, modify, adapt, publish, distribute, and exercise all copyright and publicity rights. You are responsible for indemnifying STANDS4 against any intellectual property claims arising from your contributions.

3. DMCA Notice: If you believe your copyrighted material has been infringed on the website, you must provide specific information to STANDS4's copyright agent as per the DMCA guidelines.

4. Third-Party Content: Some content on the site is sourced from external sources like WordNet®, GCIDE, Wikipedia, Wiktionary, Freebase, and LanguageTool. These are licensed under their respective licenses.

5. Copyright Infringement: STANDS4 may limit access to the service or terminate user accounts that infringe on any intellectual property rights, whether it's a first-time or repeat infringement.

The provided Terms of Service for the website https://definitions.net outlines the copyright ownership and usage rights for all materials contained within the site, as well as user-submitted content. Users who submit contributions to the site agree to grant STANDS4 LLC a perpetual, royalty-free, non-exclusive, sub-licensable right and license to use their contributions in any way they see fit.

The Terms of Service also include an indemnification clause where users agree to defend and hold harmless STANDS4 LLC against any claims or liabilities related to intellectual property or proprietary rights infringements resulting from content published by the user on the site.

To report a copyright infringement, users must follow the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) guidelines, which require providing specific information such as electronic or physical signature of an authorized representative, identification of the copyrighted work, location of the infringing material, and contact information for the reporting party. Repeat infringers may have their accounts terminated at STANDS4's discretion.

Some content on the site comes from external sources like WordNet, GCIDE, Wikipedia, Wiktionary, Freebase, and LanguageTool, all of which are licensed under their respective terms. The grammar checkers are primarily based on LanguageTool's work under a CC-BY license.

1. Copyright: All materials on the website (unless specifically specified otherwise) are copyrighted 2025 by STANDS4 LLC. Any unauthorized use or infringement of these rights will be subject to prosecution according to international copyright law and the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA).

Submissions: By submitting any content, including text, images, graphics, video, or audio, to the website, you grant STANDS4 LLC a perpetual, royalty-free, non-exclusive, sub-licensable right and license to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, translate, create derivative works from, distribute, perform, play, make available to the public, and exercise all copyright and publicity rights with respect to your submission worldwide and/or to incorporate it in other works in any media now known or later developed.
3. Indemnification: You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless STANDS4 LLC, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, losses, costs, liabilities, damages, judgments, penalties, interest, and expenses arising out or relating to any intellectual property or proprietary rights infringement by any content or other information you publish on the website.
4. DMCA Notice: If you believe that your copyrighted work has been copied in a way that constitutes copyright infringement and is accessible via the service, you must provide written notice to STANDS4's copyright agent, as required by the DMCA. The notice should include the following information:
	* An electronic or physical signature of a person authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner
	* Identification of the copyrighted work that you claim has been infringed

5. Third-party content: Some of the content on the website is derived from external sources, including WordNet®, GCIDE, Wikipedia, and Wiktionary. These sources are identified in the licensing section of the terms of service.
6. Limitations of liability: STANDS4 LLC may limit access to the website or terminate the accounts of any users who infringe intellectual property rights of others, regardless of whether there is a repeat infringement.

The provided Terms of Service document outlines the legal terms and conditions for using the website https://definitions.net. Here is a summary of the key points:

1. Copyright: All materials on the website (unless explicitly stated otherwise) are copyrighted 2025 by STANDS4 LLC. Any unauthorized use or reproduction of content may result in legal action, including prosecution under international copyright law and the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA).

Submissions: By submitting any content (e.g., text, photos, graphics, video, or audio) to the website, you grant STANDS4 LLC a perpetual, royalty-free, non-exclusive, sub-licensable right and license to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, translate, create derivative works from, distribute, perform, play, make available to the public, and exercise all copyright and publicity rights worldwide.
3. DMCA Notice: If you believe that your copyrighted work has been copied on the website in a way that constitutes copyright infringement, you must provide written notice to STANDS4's copyright agent as specified in the DMCA. The notice should include the following information:
